thread.title: Adopt-A-Dog Fundraiser Racing for Rescues @ Grand Prix New York Racing
thread.title_full: Adopt-A-Dog Fundraiser Racing for Rescues @ Grand Prix New York Racing

title: Adopt-A-Dog Fundraiser Racing for Rescues @ Grand Prix New York Racing
text:
6:00 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 Categories 
Events, Fundraisers, Sports Grand Prix New York (GPNY) announced it will host a fundraising event to support the local animal rescue charity Adopt-A-Dog. Racing for Rescues, an event in which participants can have fun racing Go-Karts while raising money for Armonk-based Adopt-A-Dog, will be held Thursday, October 15 from 6 to 8 pm. At Adopt-A-Dog's Armonk facility, staff and volunteers care for over 35 dogs at a time and more than 150 animals a year including dogs of all ages, breeds and sizes. Pets will not be permitted at the event, but Adopt-A-Dog will have information, including pictures/profiles of the dogs currently available for adoption, on hand for potential adopters. Two tracks will be provided, one for adults and one for children ages eight and older to race; twin seats will also be available for adults to drive younger children who want to participate but are not old enough to race by themselves. Individual tickets are $50. Light finger foods and non-alcoholic beverages will be served. All participants must be pre-registered. To register, please visit http://adopt-a-dog.org/. For questions on the event or about Adopt-A-Dog, please call (914) 273-1674. About Adopt-A-Dog: Adopt-A-Dog is a recognized 501(c)(3) charitable organization whose mission has been to Save, Socialize and Secure Loving Homes for Unwanted or Abandoned Dogs and Cats and has been serving the tri-state area and beyond for over three decades. The shelter, located in Armonk, is open seven days a week. Adopt-A-Dog's dedicated staff and volunteers strive to provide the best care possible while the animals are at the shelter awaiting safe and permanent homes. Related
